answers.answer: How are you? Are there other symptoms present? Was there a previous injury in your breast? Any type of tingling, burning, or numbness is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured. Having a breast that feels hot to the touch can be caused by a lot of things including: diabetes, neuropathy, Sun/Chemical/Heat burn, breast injury, infection or cancer . It is always good to see your doctor for proper evaluation and to rule out inflammatory breast cancer, a rare but very aggressive type of breast cancer which presents with redness, swelling, and warmth in the breast. You can read more about this through this link: http://www.cancer.gov/cancertopics/factsheet/sites-types/ibcTake care and keep us posted.

question: whats wrong when your breast feel like its burning.
title: breast tinging
